content.title: As her DNA test still reverberates, Sen. Elizabeth Warren’s political operation shows fissures - The Washington Post
content.desc: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) speaks in October in her campaign headquarters in Boston’s Dorchester neighborhood.Hadley Green Already battling controversy over her claimed Native American heritage, Sen. Elizabeth Warren is nearing a decision whether to seek the presidency with a second problem: fissures in the tightknit political operation that has guided her throughout her career. Mindy Myers, who was one of the primary architects of Warren’s political rise and has remained one of her close advisers, had been expected to play a senior role in the senator’s campaign. But she has been in t...

content.title: A Night at the Door With Three Boston Bouncers - PUNCH
content.desc: Boston’s nightlife scene has a mixed reputation compared to other big East Coast cities. The bars in the Massachusetts capital close at 2 a.m.; the city has an infamously tightly regulated liquor license quota; it’s illegal to discount alcohol for a portion of the day so happy hour doesn’t even exist. Toss in the fact that nearly every night you’re dealing with either students from the many colleges or rabid Pats, Bruins, Celtics and Sox fans out cheering for the local team, and it makes sense that outsiders might have their doubts. The city is, in many ways, still the original wild child o...

content.title: Ayanna Pressley has a simple message for men who are threatened by the new Congress’ many women - ThinkProgress
content.desc: Ayanna Pressley at the the headquarters of the Massachusetts Democratic Party in Dorchester, Massachusetts on September 28, 2018. (JOSEPH PREZIOSO/AFP/Getty Images) Rep.-elect Ayanna Pressley (D-MA) has had a busy week. On Wednesday, the Massachusetts congresswoman-elect gave her farewell address to the Boston City Council — where she has served since 2010. Reps.-elect Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) and Rashida Tlaib (D-MI) made the trip to support their friend, who was praised by her council colleagues for having “changed the course of history in the city of Boston” and for being “the gre...

content.title: Boston Globe: Elizabeth Warren Should Reconsider 2020 Presidential Run - HuffPost
content.desc: Three years ago, the Boston Globe’s editorial board urged Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) to run for president. Now the board is offering her much different advice: Don’t do it. In an editorial published Thursday, the Boston Globe said Warren had “missed her moment in 2016” and cast skepticism on how well the progressive Democrat, whose recent public feuding with President Donald Trump boosted her popularity, would perform as a Democratic presidential candidate for the 2020 election. “While Warren is an effective and impactful senator with an important voice nationally, she has become a div...
